result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberta K Long

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roberta K Long in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Roberta K Long.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant is facing medical issues, defense is requesting additional status date. All conditions of bail remain as previously ordered. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 9-14-22

Defendant Roberta K Long in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Roberta K Long.  Attorney Alexandria Carlson in court on behalf of Samuel E. Simpson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense has not received an offer. State to resend offer to counsel.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roberta K Long in court with Attorney Thomas C Simon; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 072445,
Payable Number: 1023156,
Receipt Number: 22RP030737,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered SCRAM bracelet to monitor the Defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Roberta K Long in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Roberta K Long in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT ELIGABLE FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER .  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
 This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
